flawed_nl_solution:
Three years from now, Kate will be 29 years + 3 years = <<29+3=32>>32 years old.
So by that time, Tully will be 32 years x 2 = <<32*2=46>>46 years old.
This means, Tully is 46 years - 3 years = <<46-3=43>>43 years old now.
Therefore, Tully was 43 years - 1 year = 42 years old last year.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 64, not 46. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
